name: Deadline Pressure
summary: Manager asks if you can deliver faster than planned

contextVariables.description: Why the deadline is being pushed

examples.fintech: the retry logic for failed transfers

contextVariables.description: When it was supposed to be done

scenarioTemplate.setup: You're in the middle of working on your current ticket when you get a message.
scenarioTemplate.message: Hey! Quick question - {reason}. Any chance we can ship {feature} by {newDeadline} instead of {originalDeadline}?

responseOptions.label: Agree immediately
responseOptions.description: Sure, I can make that work!
responseOptions.evaluationNotes: Agreeing without assessing feasibility can lead to overcommitment and stress

responseOptions.label: Push back firmly
responseOptions.description: That's not possible, the feature isn't ready and needs more time.
responseOptions.evaluationNotes: Direct refusal without alternatives can damage relationships

responseOptions.label: Ask clarifying questions
responseOptions.description: Let me understand the situation better. What specifically needs to be ready for the demo?
responseOptions.evaluationNotes: Shows engagement and helps identify the real requirements

responseOptions.label: Negotiate scope
responseOptions.description: I can have the core functionality ready by then if we defer the edge case handling. Would that work?
responseOptions.evaluationNotes: Offers a solution while being realistic about constraints

responseOptions.label: Buy time to assess
responseOptions.description: Let me check my current tasks and get back to you in an hour with what's possible.
responseOptions.evaluationNotes: Professional approach - takes time to give an accurate answer

evaluationCriteria.question: Did they communicate clearly and professionally?
Did they offer alternatives or solutions?
Did they advocate for realistic timelines?
Did they try to understand the business need?

followUpTemplates.message: Great, thanks! I'll let the client know. Let me know if you hit any blockers.
Good question! For the demo, we really just need {feature} working for the happy path. The error handling can wait.
That would actually work perfectly for the demo. Let's do that - I'll update the stakeholders.
I understand. What if we brought in Marcus to help? Or is there anything else we could deprioritize?

fintech.specificMessage: Our biggest enterprise client just scheduled a demo for Friday. Any chance we can ship the retry logic by then instead of next Wednesday?

healthcare.specificMessage: The FDA inspector is coming Monday. Any chance we can have the audit logging feature ready by Thursday instead of end of next week?

ecommerce.specificMessage: Marketing just moved up the Black Friday prep. Can we have the new checkout flow ready by this Friday instead of in 2 weeks?
